caption: I normally don't write reviews. I'll start off with saying the food was amazing but the lack of care by the waitress to take my peanut allergies into consideration caused me to have anxiety about every bite and honestly ruined my experience. Why ask about allergies and then ask if I'm ok with cross contamination? I've never experienced such careless attitude towards allergies when dining in Chicago The waitress also charged me twice.

An omakase experience we will never forget. Terrific service, amazing fresh good that will tantalize every taste bud. We had the pleasure of eating at the Vegas location years ago but only today did we get the true Nobu experience. We will be back again and again and again.

This was absolutely perfect!   From the moment we met Savannah at the bar, she made amazing drinks for us all evening and could not have been more fun, knowledgeable and professional!  Her partner, Alexis, was excellent as well and as a team, they are second to none! Our server, Chloe, impressed us with her amazing knowledge of the menu as we had many questions about the food, drinks and the sake!  We would have guessed Chloe was with NoBu for years, but she informed us it was her 2nd day after her training cycle, she is a definite asset to NoBu to say the least!   We will be back and already making plans to bring some other friends along to enjoy the experience!  Thank you!

It’s now one of my favorite restaurants in Chicago. The ambiance is very welcoming and charming. Amazing cocktails, food and service. Staff are extremely knowledgeable and make great recommendations. I highly recommend trying yellowtail jalapeño.
OMG!!!!!!!!! YUMMY!!!!! Everything was so DELICIOUS!!!!

Love it here. Would come back every weekend. Our server was amazing, love that they give good recommendations and also will choose selections for you. I had the sidecar to drink and if you like whiskey it’s so good. Also the yellowtail is a must!

In my 35 years on this earth, I have had many waiters and waitresses. Some have been good, some have been great, but none have been as good as Chloe. When we sat down, Chloe captured our imaginations with her descriptions of delicatessen entrees that would be prepared for us. Her descriptions were so vivid that I could practically taste the entree before it even arrived to the table. Although she was wearing a mask, her smile was so bright it warmed my soul with every plate she set down. Incredible service, great food, Chloe was awesome.
By far the best dining experience I have ever had. Anywhere. Everyone was so enjoyable and attentive to our needs and our waitress Brittany was amazing!

I'm a first timer and I have not been to any of the other locations. There simply wasn't a dish I didn't like. The service was personable and unpretentious. The restaurant layout was gorgeous. The staff were diverse. The ambiance was lively with consideration of safety. I will return.
Fanrastic thats all I can say!!
Perfect in every way. Drinks are delish and strong. Staff is friendly and knowledgeable of the menu. Most importantly Every dish is fresh and tasty.

We had to delay gratification literally as we planned to dine back in November for my birthday but went recently for our anniversary instead. John David guided us through a whimsical dining experience of Matsuhisa's creations that both of us enjoyed throughly. The service and food were phenomenal.

Absolutely perfect dinner out. We enjoyed the yellowtail jalapeño, wagyu tacos, black miso cod, rock shrimp tempura ... my mouth is still watering. Service was good and Covid protocols in place. We’ve been to the NYC flagship and all parts were consistent with what you’d expect from a Nobu experience.
Always a fun time. The food is solid.
the lamb chop anticucho is incredible. the rest is good but vastly overpriced (not surprising bc of the name).
Wonderful restaurant.

Do NOT order any specials! We went here in this past Saturday I was soooo excited. It was my 41st birthday and I’m celebrating my second PhD. I was told by my waiter who I originally thought was the sweetest guy that my meal would be $30 so I ordered two. I was originally going to order the shrimp tempura when he said there were “specials ”. When I think of specials I think of a deal right? So we’re having the greatest time it’s time to go and the bill is $600. Mins you were from a beautiful city Port Huron MI and are only there for two days as we both work very hard. I am attending Yale and my husband owns a roofing company. We were taken advantage of plain and simple and I’m not sure why they chose us to do this to as were good Christian people. I spoke with a man claiming to be the general manager who said he would refund us $150 that day. He confirmed my email and credit card details. I’ve received no refund or confirmation email of the refund. Had to leave a Message on 11/09/20 because there were “no managers there” yesterday. I just want what was promised to us. I wish this never happened because I loved it at first all the way up until the bill came. We literally had cocktails bbq sliders and two orders of lamb no sides. $600... hogwash! I’ve emailed twice and hope this is rectified today. I’ve spoken with my attorney and filed a report with Chicago police as well. Just because I’m a PhD doesn’t mean I order $600 dinners! We are frugal good Americans who work hard for our money and others!  Ebony Bankston PhD

Nobu is a restaurant that finally has large enough tables for all the food you're are about to order. The Chicago location is indeed a very good location. Some people think of Nobu of a high end sushi place, but it has Peruvian infusions that alter the traditional taste of sushi and take you in a new culinary experience. I undoubtedly recommend to everyone to try their food. The wait staff is highly trained and knowledgeable about the food they serve and the specialty cocktails are the icing on the cake.
Exceeded expectations in such a tumultuous time!
Such a fun experience! Our food was delicious and the drinks were so yummy & strong! Loved everything, including our service!

The rooftop has amazing views with great tasty drinks that they will easily customize for you.  The limited menu is great for small bites but if you want the full selection, you will need to dine in the restaurant on the 1st floor.
Put this  restaurant on your  Chicago roof top check out list...cool, chic, sophisticated !
Very delicious food, great service .

Fantastic experience, first time at any Nobu. Took my mother, and we both loved everything we got. We were lucky and able to get a table last second. Everything was beyond clean and safe Covid wise. Plan on going back again in the future! Also, if you can during the fall the Tempura pumpkin is FANTASTIC! Would not have ever thought of getting that before but now wish we had gotten more of it

Nobu is one of my great pleasures in life. The food and flavors are amazing. Every experience is better than the previous. I have been waiting for the Chicago location to open for years. The uni shooters are better than any others I've tried. The dishes are rich, yet light and satisfying. The service has always been fantastic. The cocktails are very good. I will continue to keep going back to one of my favorite restaurants
Great view. Felt rushed because our waitress said we could only stay for one hour at our table, so we only had one drink each and shared 2 small tuna rolls.

Let me begin by say the service was awful. We had to wait almost 40 minutes to place our food order. The waitress was argumentative and contentious.  We had to talk to the manager several times to place our order as well get our food. She messed up our order and then argued and made excuses. The food was mediocre at best and very expensive.  To top off the meal she accused us of leaving her a $5 tip on a 400 dollar bill and confronted us about it. She was left a more the generous tip considering how poor the service was. She did not know how to reconcile the machine to see her true tip.  Needless to say, I will not be returning!
Just like New York, Vegas and at the Bahamas...excellent as usual.

Fantastic, definitely worth the wait. We enjoyed the ribeye baos so much so, we ordered seconds! We also had the lamb and the steak in truffle butter. The creative cocktails were both delicious and entertaining. We enjoyed our entire experience here. Given the ongoing concerns of COVID-19, we felt safe during our dining experience. Due to the highly anticipated opening, the month wait is understandable especially considering social distancing rules, they can't service everyone. But I can attest to the quality of cleanliness and their level 0f professionalism, they are doing their best. I can't wait to go back. Wish they took standing reservations... :p

The food itself was good, and the rooftop has a great view.  However, for the price you pay, you’d want the entire experience to be excellent. Our server was not knowledgeable about the food at all. We ordered food, and after we were halfway through he came by to ask if he told us the specials. He then stumbled his way through the specials, and we asked about food allergies (gluten) for certain items on the menu. He gave us to OK and we placed the order. When he returned he let us know he was mistaken and it did have gluten, then shared other items we could order instead. We place another order and when he comes back, he informs us AGAIN that it actually did contain gluten. So after spending 2/3 of our time waiting on confirmation of food allergens, we decided to end the meal early.  You’d just expect a high end restaurant to have something like food allergens figured out.

Food is great. Pricey though. Lamb was excellent. Hamachi jalapeno was very good as well. Our party loved the ribeye sliders. Drinks were very good as well. Service was excellent. If you want traditional sushi there are more reasonable prices elsewhere, but this place was worth the price every once in a while.
